intro: Pithecellobium vulcanorum, commonly known as the volcanic acacia, is a shrub native to the volcanic soils of Central America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to nutrient-poor, acidic soils, often found in disturbed or volcanic landscapes. It plays a role in soil stabilization and provides habitat for various insects and small animals. Its seeds are encased in a hard pod, which opens to release the seeds when mature.
